content:
Download ISO image and tools Download ISO image(archlinux-xxxx.xx.xx-x86_64.iso)
Download rufus(rufus-x.xp.exe)
Download ihasher
Create installation USB flash drive Caution: The created installation USB drive will be formatted, all contents inside will be deleted!
If you are asked if you want to allow updates and confirm formatting the USB drive, click “Yes”.
Reserved partitions Press Windows+R and enter diskmgmt.msc Select UEFI mode and enter the u disk to install the system Select UEFI mode to boot, it varies from computer to computer, please follow the computer manual or search online for this procedure.
Update system time root@archiso ~ # timedatectl set-ntp truePartition root@archiso ~ # fdisk -lDevices ending in rom, loop or airoot can be ignored in the result.
For a selected device, the following partitions are mandatory.
A root partition (mounted in the root directory)/
An EFI system partition
Please use fdisk or parted to modify the partition table. For example:
root@archiso ~ # fdisk /dev/the_disk_to_be_partitionedMount PointsPartitionPartition TypeRecommended size/mnt/boot/dev/efi_system_partitionEFI System PartitionAt least 260 MiB/mnt/dev/root_partitionLinux x86-64 root_partition (/)Remaining spaceFormatting partitions root@archiso ~ # mkfs.ext4 /dev/root_partitionroot@archiso ~ # mkfs.fat -F 32 /dev/efi_system_partitionMount partitions Mount the root volume to /mnt and the efi system volume to /mnt/boot
root@archiso ~ # mkdir /mnt/bootroot@archiso ~ # mount /dev/root_partition /mntroot@archiso ~ # mount /dev/ /mnt/bootSetting the mirror source root@archiso ~ # reflector --country China --age 12 --protocol https --sort rate --save /etc/pacman.d/mirrorlistInstall the required packages root@archiso ~ # pacstrap /mnt base linux linux-firmwareConfiguration System Fstab Generate the fstab file with the following command (set the UUID or volume label with the -U or -L option).
root@archiso ~ # genfstab -U /mnt >> /mnt/etc/fstabIt is highly recommended to check the generated /mnt/etc/fstab file after executing the above command to make sure it is correct.
Chroot Enter your new system.
root@archiso ~ # arch-chroot /mnt[root@archiso /]#Timezone [root@archiso /]# ln -sf /usr/share/zoneinfo/Asia/Shanghai /etc/localtime[root@archiso /]# hwclock --systohcSet Locale Edit /etc/locale.gen,and then uncomment en_US.UTF-8 UTF-8(delete #)ã€‚
[root@archiso /]# vim /etc/locale.gen[root@archiso /]# locale-gen[root@archiso /]# vim /etc/locale.confLANG=en_US.UTF-8Network Configuration Create hostname file:
/etc/hostname
myhostname(set your own hostname here)Add the corresponding information to the hosts:
[root@archiso /]# vim /etc/hosts127.0.0.1	localhost::1	localhost127.0.1.1	myhostname.localdomain	myhostnameset password for root [root@archiso /]# passwdInstallation of boot, kernel, and networking related packages [root@archiso /]# pacman -S grub efibootmgr intel-ucode os-prober wpa_supplicant dhcpcdConfigure refind boot [root@archiso /]# pacman -S refind[root@archiso /]# refind-install[root@archiso /]# nano /boot/refind.conf"Boot with standard options" "root-UUID-(root_partition_uuid) rw loglevel=3 quiet""Boot to single-user mode" "root-UUID-(root_partition_uuid) rw loglevel=3 quiet""Boot with minimal options" "ro root=/dew/(root_partition_path)"Exit chroot [root@archiso /]# exitroot@archiso ~ # umount -R /mntroot@archiso ~ # reboot[1]ArchWiki. Installation guide[EB/OL]. [2022-3-16]. https://wiki.archlinux.org/title/Installation_guide.
title: Archlinux Installation guide

content:
If you have learned the basic operation of the computer (such as switching on and off, clicking the mouse and keyboard…) the next step, you should learn the principles of computer use.
General First, brave Some people say that I was born with computer skills, but this is not true. The ability to use a computer depends on your attitude towards the computer. You need to think of the computer as a toy, not a tool, and you need to think of the system and software as a game. As long as you don’t go to dangerous areas such as fiddling with system settings, you generally won’t break your computer. So: be brave! Be brave to try and gain experience. Don’t be afraid of this or that. If you hold back, you will never see the other side of victory.
Second, check If you have any questions, go to Bing and search for it. Don’t use Baidu anymore, it’s all advertisements and useless shoddy information. Remember, check before asking.
Three, note When you learn a skill, remember it.
Four, practice Practice more, try more, summarize more
Five, realize Never expect the most detailed tutorial, you need to comprehend and explore the unknown world by yourself.
taboo Put the file on the desktop Install the software to the C drive Indiscriminately downloading software from the Internet Name the software installation directory and system user name in Chinese install software The first problem that plagues many computer beginners is installing software. Open pc.qq.com, search for the software name in the search bar on the upper right, and then find the software you want in the results, click the <span style=“color:red” on the green button on the right “>Small arrow and click Normal Download. Open the downloaded installation package, 95% of the software can customize the installation location during installation. Create a new folder on the D drive and name it the same as the software name (in English, capitalized). If the software name is in Chinese, please spell it in pinyin with capitalized first letter, without spaces (such as Baofengyingyin: Baofeng), do not add any Punctuation. Select the directory to install. Pay attention to detail options when installing.
Uninstall software First preparations Click the link below to download Geek Uninstaller Click me to download Save it in the D drive and create a new folder (named Geek)
Uninstall method Open geek, find the software you want to uninstall, right-click to uninstall. Follow the prompts to uninstall in the pop-up uninstallation window. Then go back to the geek window and click delete. Then close geek after the progress bar is complete.
